### Better Global Tools, Better Global Communities: Recommendations for Trust & Safety Teams When Building and Procuring Multilingual Tools


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article "Better Global Tools, Better Global Communities: Recommendations for Trust & Safety Teams When Building and Procuring Multilingual Tools" emphasizes the importance of developing multilingual capabilities in digital tools to enhance global communication and community safety. It provides recommendations for trust and safety teams on how to effectively build and procure these tools, highlighting key steps such as understanding cultural nuances, engaging native speakers for accuracy, prioritizing inclusivity, and ensuring that tools can adapt to various languages and cultural contexts. By implementing these strategies,

### ServiceNow Patches Critical AI Platform Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated User Impersonation


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


ServiceNow has released patches for a critical security vulnerability in its AI platform that could allow unauthenticated users to impersonate legitimate accounts. The flaw, which was discovered and reported by security researchers, posed a significant risk as it could enable attackers to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information and systems. ServiceNow has urged users to apply the updates promptly to mitigate potential security breaches. This move underscores the importance of regularly updating software to protect against emerging threats and safeguard user data and system integrity.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2026/01/servicenow-patches-critical-ai-platform.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_3264)**

üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The webinar titled "Securing Agentic AI: From MCPs and Tool Access to Shadow API Key Sprawl" explores the growing security challenges associated with agentic artificial intelligence systems. It delves into the complexities of managing multiple control points (MCPs), ensuring secure tool access, and addressing the issue of shadow API key sprawl, which can lead to unauthorized access and security vulnerabilities. The session highlights the importance of implementing robust security measures to protect AI systems from potential threats and stresses the need for

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2026/01/webinar-t-from-mcps-and-tool-access-to.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1048)**

### New Malware Campaign Delivers Remcos RAT Through Multi-Stage Windows Attack


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


A recent cybersecurity report highlights a sophisticated malware campaign utilizing a multi-stage attack strategy to deliver the Remcos Remote Access Trojan (RAT) on Windows systems. The campaign begins with phishing emails that contain malicious attachments or links, which, when engaged, execute a series of obfuscated scripts to bypass security measures. These scripts eventually deliver the Remcos RAT, allowing attackers to gain unauthorized access to users' systems. The RAT can perform various malicious activities, such as data theft and system manipulation, underscoring

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2026/01/new-malware-campaign-delivers-remcos.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_7559)**
